summary:
* Recognizes the vulnerability of women and children forcefully abducted into armed groups and armed forces to sexual violence (para 17)
* Demands the immediate identification and release of such persons from armed groups (para 17)

**Capacity Building and Assistance**

* Encourages Member States to draw upon the expertise of the UN Team of Experts to strengthen the rule of law and address sexual violence (para 18)
* Urges UN entities and donors to provide comprehensive health services, including sexual and reproductive health, to survivors of sexual violence (para 19)
* Calls for support to national institutions and local civil society networks in providing services to survivors (para 19)

**HIV and AIDS**

* Notes the link between sexual violence and HIV infection, and the disproportionate burden on women and girls (para 20)
* Urges support for national health systems and civil society networks to provide sustainable assistance to women and girls living with or affected by HIV and AIDS (para 20)

**Civil Society and Reporting**

* Underlines the important role of civil society organizations, including women's organizations, in enhancing community-level protection against sexual violence (para 21)
* Requests the Secretary-General to submit annual reports on the implementation of women and peace and security resolutions (para 22)
* Decides to remain actively seized of the matter (para 23).
